Class AbstractBaseMapCrudService<T extends AbstractBaseObject>

java.lang.Object
com.pandora.general.objects.services.abstractions.classes.AbstractMapCrudService<T,Long>
com.pandora.general.objects.services.abstractions.classes.AbstractBaseMapCrudService<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of entity managed by the service, extending AbstractBaseObject.
All Implemented Interfaces:
CrudService<T,Long>
Direct Known Subclasses:
CellMapCrudService, CellTimestepMapCrudService, RiverMapCrudService, RiverTimestepMapCrudService
public abstract class AbstractBaseMapCrudService<T extends AbstractBaseObject> extends AbstractMapCrudService<T,Long>
The AbstractBaseMapCrudService is an abstract class extending the AbstractMapCrudService and providing additional functionality for managing AbstractBaseObject entities. It includes a method for saving an AbstractBaseObject to the underlying map with an assigned or existing ID.

This class is intended to be extended by concrete implementations to leverage common CRUD functionality for entities of type T extending AbstractBaseObject.

Version:
0.0.1
Author:
Wim Joost van Hoek

  • Method Details

    • save

      public T save(T baseCommand)
      Saves the given AbstractBaseObject to the underlying map.

      This method checks if the provided object has a non-null ID. If the ID is null, it assigns the next available ID by invoking the getNextId() method. The object is then saved to the map using the ID and the AbstractMapCrudService.save(Object, Object) method.

      If the underlying map is empty, the initial ID assigned is 1L. Otherwise, the next available ID is determined by incrementing the maximum existing ID in the map by 1.

      Parameters:
      baseCommand - The AbstractBaseObject to be saved.
      Returns:
      The saved AbstractBaseObject with an assigned or existing ID.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If the provided baseCommand is null.
      See Also:
      • The underlying method used for saving objects to the map.
      • The method used for determining the next available ID.
